intro: Platygyria variabilis, commonly known as the variable flatleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
